current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish a board of directors and CEO to oversee the Federal Exchange and State Exchanges, and
			 to provide health insurance oversight.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subtitle D of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:D
usc/42/18021/etseq

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: headed by a
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and directed by a
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to oversee management of
			 the Federal Exchange and State Exchanges, and to provide health insurance
			 oversight.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: There is established the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall appoint a
, by and with the consent of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, who
			 shall be responsible for administering the Federal Exchange, for
			 overseeing State
			 Exchanges, and for health insurance oversight.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: The
report directly to the
be accountable for implementation of the Federal Exchange and oversight of the State Exchanges;
be responsible for all Federal health insurance oversight; and

serve the public interest of individuals seeking health insurance, serve businesses seeking access
			 to
			 health coverage through the Exchanges, and ensure the efficient
			 operation and function of the Exchanges.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an individual shall have a background in
			 health care issues and private-sector management experience.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: To be eligible for appointment as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

on the operation
			 of the Federal Exchange, implementation of the State Exchanges, and health
			 insurance
			 oversight, including—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: The
the functionality of healthcare.gov (or any subsequent Internet  site), including SHOP exchanges;

ensuring that enrollment information is properly transferred from healthcare.gov (or any subsequent
			 Internet site) to State Medicaid agencies;
accuracy of enrollee information submitted through the Exchanges;
ensuring the accuracy of advanced premium tax credits;
ensuring the accuracy of payment to insurers;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to the implementation of

and potential policy changes with respect to such
			 section and associated reporting requirements;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 4980H of the Internal

text.#text: providing recommendations to the
creating an automated appeals system for healthcare.gov (or any subsequent Internet  site);
overseeing the transition from a State Exchange to the Federal Exchange;
overseeing the Federal contracting related to healthcare.gov (or any subsequent Internet site);

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the oversight and administration

text.#text: The

text.#text:
Three representatives of the private sector who have demonstrated knowledge in individual health
			 care coverage, small employer health care coverage, administering a public
			 or private health care delivery system, operating complex information
			 system technologies, or promoting health and wellness, appointed by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
described in subparagraphs (A) through (D) of paragraph (3)
			 shall serve for a term that is concurrent with the member’s term as an
			 officer within the Federal
			 department or agency.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: Each member of the

Each member of the board described in paragraph (3)(E) shall be appointed for a term of 3 years and
			 may be reappointed for a term of an additional 2
			 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall serve as
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
Chair of the Board of Directors

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in carrying out their duties, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a technical advisory committee.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: To assist the
The technical advisory committee shall be comprised of the following:
One technical expert from the
One representative of the health insurance industry.
One representative of health care consumer groups.
One representative of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners.
One representative of the State Medicaid agencies.
One representative from the small business community.

One representative of Federal information technology contractors involved in the operation and
			 development of
			 healthcare.gov (or any subsequent Internet  site).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, up to 2  additional members, selected by
			 the

and approved

Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: At the discretion of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall appoint one member of the technical advisory committee to

text.#text: The

Each member of the technical advisory committee shall be appointed for a term of 3 years and may be
			 reappointed for a term of an additional 2 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 in cooperation with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall develop a work
			 plan with respect to duties described in subsection (c)(2), indicating the
			 priority and schedule the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
will take in addressing such
			 duties.   The work plan
			 shall be displayed on healthcare.gov (or any
			 subsequent Internet  site).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Board of Directors of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

text.#text: Not later than 3 months after the date of enactment of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Chief Executive Officer of the Marketplace Health Insurance Corporation

, shall submit an annual

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and

on the status of the Federal Exchange

			 the
and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
under subsection (c)(2)
			 and remaining issues to be

text.#text: Not later than February 1 of each year, the
